## [FileRequest](https://kmp.telereso.io/docs/core/latest/-core/io.telereso.kmp.core.models/-file-request/index.html){:target="_blank"}

Class Wrapper of a file to pass from platform side to common module and use it to send via ktor

---

## Create a FileRequest


<div class="code-block kotlin swift js">
<div class="tab">
  <button class="tablinks kotlin active" onclick="openTab(event, 'kotlin')">Kotlin</button>
  <button class="tablinks swift" onclick="openTab(event, 'swift')">Swift</button>
  <button class="tablinks js" onclick="openTab(event, 'js')">JS</button>
</div>

<div class="tabcontent kotlin active">

{% highlight kotlin %}

```kotlin
val base64 = ""
FileRequest(base64,"image.png") // passing base64 and name
FileRequest(base64,"image.png","image/png") // passing base64, name and content type
FileRequest(base64,"image.png","image/png"){ percentage ->
    println("Upload... ${percentage}%")
} // passing base64, name, content type and upload progress
```

{% endhighlight kotlin %}

</div>

<div class="tabcontent swift">
{% highlight swift %}

```swift
val base64 = ""
FileRequest(base64: base64, name: "image.png") // passing base64 and name
FileRequest(base64: base64, name: "image.png", contentType: "image/png") // passing base64, name and content type
FileRequest(base64:base64, name:"image.png",progress:{ percentage in
    print("Upload... \(percentage)%")
}
```

{% endhighlight swift %}

</div>

<div class="tabcontent js">

{% highlight kotlin %}

```javascript
const base64 = ""
CoreModels.FileRequest(base64,"image.png") // passing base64 and name
CoreModels.FileRequest.withContentType(base64,"image.png","image/png") // passing base64, with content type
CoreModels.FileRequest.withProgress(base64,"image.png", (percentage)=>{
    console.log("File Upload:",percentage)
}) // passing base64, with progresss
```

{% endhighlight kotlin %}

</div>

</div>

---

## Send FileRequest with ktor 

```kotlin
// Common module
fun uploadFile(file: FileRequest) {
    httpClient.post("https://my.domain.org/api/v1/upload") {
        setBody(MultiPartFormDataContent(formData {
            append("file", file.getByteArray(), Headers.build {
                append(HttpHeaders.ContentType, file.getType().toString())
                append(HttpHeaders.ContentDisposition, "filename=${file.name}")
            })
        }))
        onUpload { bytesSentTotal, contentLength ->
            val progress = (bytesSentTotal * 100L / contentLength).toInt()
            file.progress(progress)
        }
    }
}

```

## Send multiple FileRequests with ktor

```kotlin
// Platform module
val base64_1 = ""
val base64_2 = ""
val uploadProgress :(Int) -> Unit = { percentage ->
    println("Upload... $percentage%")
}

// we use same listener for all files 

uploadFiles(listOf(
    FileRequest(base64_1,"image1.png",progress = uploadProgress),
    FileRequest(base64_2,"image2.png",progress = uploadProgress)
))

// Common module
fun uploadFiles(files: List<FileRequest>) {
    httpClient.post("https://my.domain.org/api/v1/upload") {
        setBody(MultiPartFormDataContent(formData {
            files.forEach { file -> 
                append("files", file.getByteArray(), Headers.build {
                    append(HttpHeaders.ContentType, file.getType().toString())
                    append(HttpHeaders.ContentDisposition, "filename=${file.name}")
                })  
            }
        }))
        onUpload { bytesSentTotal, contentLength ->
            val progress = (bytesSentTotal * 100L / contentLength).toInt()
            files.lastOrNull()?.progress(progress) // notice we used the last listener only
        }
    }
}
```
